creditline: The Eloise and Elliot Kaplan Endowment for Judaica
description: domed circular base with repousee spiral fluting, supporting a 2-1/8" square box housing a removable drawer with four compartments for spices and an escalloped sconce which holds havdalah candle which slides along four wires at the candle is used to the stop straight sconce
provenance: (Sotheby's, Jerusalem, 1985); Dick Janger, Highland Park, Illinois; Purchased by the MIA in 2006.
text: This work by the Nuremberg silversmith Johann Samuel Beckensteiner combines two of the three object types required for havdalah: the candle and the spice box. The spices were kept in the removable drawer, which is divided into four compartments, suggesting that a combination of different spices might have been used.
title: Havdalah candle holder and spice box
